title: Peru: Citibank Holds Forum on Mining, Energy and Infrastructure
summary: Lima - As part of its efforts to promote the treasury market and share best practices with strategic sectors of the national economy, Citibank recently organized the Forum on Mining, Energy and Infrastructure.
tag-1: Peru: Citibank Holds Forum on Mining, Energy and Infrastructure
tag-3: Lima – As part of its efforts to promote the treasury market and share best practices with strategic sectors of the national economy, Citibank recently organized the Forum on Mining, Energy and Infrastructure.
tag-4: Participants included prominent executives from Peru and around the region, among them Mario Farren, General Manager, Citibank Peru; Peter Langshaw, Head of Global Sales—Energy, Chemical and Mining, Citibank; Gabriel Angeloro, Regional Manager, Connectivity and Integration, Citibank Latin America; and Renzo Ángeles, Head of Sales, Citibank Peru.
tag-5: "Citi is honored to organize this type of event. We are active participants in these sectors alongside leading players in the market. The value of encounters like these is in exchanging experiences and ideas about financial and treasury management," Farren remarked.
tag-6: Invited speakers included Peru's Vice Minister of Mining, Guillermo Shinno, who offered an overview of the outlook for the country's mining and energy sector; and Rossana Novoa and Jimena De Vinatea, Treasury Managers at Hochschild and Ferreyros, respectively, who shared their experiences with treasury management at their companies.
tag-7: "It is important to share successful experiences and good business practices," Peter Langshaw said in summarizing the outlook for the market. "From a global perspective in the industry, we are starting to see more optimism with regard to business opportunities. Prices are beginning to stabilize, a lot of ratings agencies are changing their grades to 'stable,' demand for raw materials is improving, and China is showing interest in improving its fiscal and political stimulus programs."
tag-8: Gabriel Angeloro, an expert on connectivity issues, emphasized the transparency in House to House (HTH) services. "Connectivity is automation. Using this type of system enables transparent processes for using banking services and optimizes company's resources. Implementing these systems can be complicated, but the results are visible in the short term in the performance of the financial and treasury areas."
tag-9: Renzo Ángeles, for his part, underscored the importance and challenges of diversifying funding sources for working capital and the process of obtaining it. "Direct financing is not necessarily the only source of funding," he noted. "Other options should also be considered. The global trend with regard to what we're seeing is that there is a lot of improvement in this area and new efficiencies in working capital management."
tag-10: The challenges facing these areas, Ángeles continued, include implementing new technology, accounting considerations of working capital solutions, and centralizing and optimizing processes.
tag-11: * All references to Citibank should be taken to mean Citibank del Perú S.A
